course.subject: ISOM
course.name: Business Protections for Innovations
course.description: This course addresses the problems and challenges related to regulatory and business protections for business and scientific innovations, product innovations, service innovations, software licenses, encryption, innovation reengineering, trademark, copyright, music downloading, digital entertainment, data mining and personal privacy.

reviews.author: Cool_
reviews.title: An interesting course with fair grading
reviews.comment_content:
The content is quite interesting indeed.
Talking about the stories of different events about technology.

And I am having more understanding towards the internet related products, like how they can succeed in a short period of time.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor is not native english speaker.

I think his teaching is fair and I did enjoy it actually.
reviews.comment_grading: I think the grade is fair but not very good.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not very heavy.
Even though there are many components that need to be graded, they are rather easy and simple task.

reviews.author: wksm
reviews.title: chill吹水靚grade
reviews.comment_content:
主要講IP（copyright patent trademark）同business strategies
全部都係入門factual野
reviews.comment_teaching:
上堂chill住吹水，tues class係case study
上堂多啲同Ted吹下水同actively答問題就得
唔想上堂舉手講可以喺canvas discussion board問問題（我自己無點喺discussion board講野，都係最後deadline嗰日先hea問hea答少少野）
Ted好fun同好有IP方面嘅經驗所以都好多水吹
同埋好鍾意抽大陸水（active嘅好多都好黃XD）
reviews.comment_grading:
online quiz：13個星期 每星期一個quiz 每份8題 最低分嗰兩分會exclude
final exam：3個鐘 open book open notes open google，有short qs有case questions
google都無乜用，純粹可以cite source同refer返其他類似嘅case
識得copyright patent trademark嘅definition同特徵，同埋佢地有咩特別就答到大部分short qs
case qs都唔難


最後A
reviews.comment_workload:
workload唔重，self-learning可以揀上thur lecture或者online video（剩係睇ppt唔夠，得好少字無乜explanation）再做quiz，13份8題，最低分嗰兩分會exclude
tues lecture計attn同parti，點都要上，開唔開cam都得但係開cam會多啲impression啦;) 開始前早到少少同Ted吹水+impression
optional嘅reading我就無睇過嘅。。。

reviews.author: yoyoyohohoho
reviews.title: worst CC
reviews.comment_content: the content is easy. The content is interesting and is about copyright, patent and fair use related, however, the grading is not good.
reviews.comment_teaching: His english is difficult to understand on zoom. He talked so slow and difficult to get what he is saying.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is very worst.
quizzes all above mean but still only get C range. The exam is 3 hours long and very difficult to answer the question.
reviews.comment_workload: There is one quiz each week and the quiz is quite easy but it is tricky as well but the mean is very high.

reviews.author: 3ub
reviews.title: Great Class
reviews.comment_content:
Four main categories
1. Copyright
2. Patent
3. Trademark
4. Business Strategies

You will learn each category in depth, then compare and utilize them in real life situations/cases.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very profound in his knowledge, and he leads the class discussion very well. He does it in a degree where non-business students (students with science & engineering bkg) can also understand the contents thoroughly (unless you are not fluent at English..)
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is quite fair. Got 20/20 for participation, 10/10 for attendance, average 6.5~8/8 on the weekly quiz (can drop 2 lowest score), and 94/100 on the final exam = got A
(the average for the final exam was around 83 with sd of 8.

The final exam comprised of T/F short answers and long answer questions. The questions were very general with a lot of various possible answers, so I think it was fairly easy if you know the contents.
reviews.comment_workload:
Since there is only one class per week, you have to listen to the lecture through computer (like homework) and do a small quiz. Takes only hr~2hr to do so. There is also an optional reading material (as it says it is optional, I did fine on the exam without reading any of those).

Not much to study or even memorize. You just have to come to class, participate in the discussion, and then you will understand the contents with no problem and perform well on the final exam too.

reviews.author: somebody
reviews.comment_content: The content is interesting which interesting which includes copyright, trademark, patent, and strategy.
reviews.comment_teaching: I really enjoyed how the professor teaches and interacts with students. He makes every concept clear so that is not a problem for students without a business background.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite good. I do not have any business background but I can get a B+. Just make sure you watch the videos before going to classes or else you will have no idea what the professor is talking about and that will be a mess before the final. Attendance and participation count.
reviews.comment_workload: Fair. You will have to watch the lecture videos and do the quiz before going to lessons every week. Face-to-face lectures are mostly about discussing certain topics and issues. You also have to write an essay on the topic given (copyright). No midterm but do have a final which includes MCs, short questions and a case study.

reviews.author: Orange_C
reviews.title: A very good CCC
reviews.comment_content: Pretty basic knowledge about copyright, patent and trademark. Quite interesting cases, but not very practical in reality. Always gives you a sense of "Wow, what I do is actually illegal, and I may be prosecuted". Really fulfilled the requirement of how a CCC should look like.
reviews.comment_teaching: The classes are quite packed. The professor is really learned with a very broad eyesight over all fields. Enjoyable taking his classes.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair, you get a good grade if you work hard enough. There is no final exam or midterms, only 2 assignments, 3 quizzes, and 1 final paper. Each of them 15%, the final paper worths 25%. The quizzes are mostly yes or no question which are basic. The assignments are related to the course materials.
reviews.comment_workload: No homework. Only some reading materials each week, which is optional. Some of them are quite useful in finishing the papers, but others are basiclly useless for the assessment. So you have the freedom to do it or not.

reviews.author: GrantWesley
reviews.comment_content: The course focuses on patent/copyright laws. Therefore the class doesn't really fall into either an IS or an OM class. However, it is still really interesting if you give it a chance!
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is a very experienced ISOM lecturer with many years of experience in the industry. Do not be afraid to ask him any technology related questions. even though the class centers mostly on law, the professor does a good job of focusing on the impact certain laws have on technological innovations in Asia/America.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is fairly generous. Be sure to pay attention in class, as many of the discussions will provide for solid long answer/essay ideas for the final!
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload. Keep up with the readings and go to class. The rest will take care of itself.

reviews.author: MovieTeddy
reviews.title: Comprehensive content and good grading
reviews.comment_content: A very comprehensive picture of methods to protect innovation. Many real-life cases are used to illustrate the laws and concepts which makes the whole thing more interesting. The final lessons discussed the interaction and combinations of methods used which is good as well.
reviews.comment_teaching: Agree that the professors speak a little slow and in long paragraphs, but overall understandable. And as half of the class is in the form of videos, you can feel free to speed up or stop whenever you like. The class discussions are the main part of the class and it is important to understand how the professor thinks.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is based largely on PARTICIPATION. In the one class and one online discussion forum per week, it is important to be present and make an impression on the professor. You need to join discussions and make appropriate comments afterwards. Your final exam scores will not be released, as well as the overall scores for each section. But I believe if you pay more effort into classes and discussions and understand the professor's logic of thinking, your grades will be fine.
reviews.comment_workload: Fair workload. Need to participate in one class, one quiz (8-question) and one online discussion per week. Only one final exam. The workload depends on your expectation in grading.

reviews.author: Zagala
reviews.title: Overrated course with unclear grading scheme
reviews.comment_content:
The course covers various topics related to business protection, including copyrights, trademarks, patents, and business strategies. The content and case study are pretty interesting by themselves but not in-depth.

There will be a discussion section every week where you can use the knowledge you acquired in the pre-recorded lecture videos in practical case studies.

Unfortunately, the course materials are not helpful by any means for the examination. Make sure you read the articles and focus on the discussion classes.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Ted is knowledgeable and humorous, having extensive knowledge of intellectual properties.

There will be two classes per week, one is mandatory, and another is optional. Most students will just watch the online lecture videos and skip the optional class.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% Attendance
20% Active Participation in Discussion Class
33% Quizzes
37% Final Examination

Out of 13 quizzes, the final calculation will drop the lowest two. Besides attendance and quizzes, there is no way to know your score in the other two categories. Try your best to give the professor a good impression (I guess). I think I screwed up here and ended up with C-range even though I got full marks in attendance and quizzes.
reviews.comment_workload: Most importantly, DO NOT skip any discussion classes and make sure you respond to Professor Ted. The rest will include reading the lecture videos and doing the quizzes, which will take ~2hrs per week. Fair enough for a CC course.

reviews.author: dadada
reviews.title: ok geh cc
reviews.comment_content:
Copyright,Patent,trademark and strategies to protect ip are discussed.
The content is actually useful? It's applicable to day-to-day life.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof is very experienced with the topics and KNOWS what he's talking about.
He's fun for what he is teaching(law, cmon).
He'd answer your question and explain the materials with tonnes of illustrative examples. So it's quite easy to understand the content.
And he replies to your email pretty fast, that's a plus.
reviews.comment_grading:
A

13 quizzes in total. Easy to get high/full mark. Lowest 3 will get dropped. Unlimited attempts.
Quizzes:
Week 1:7.67/8
Week 2: 8
Week 3: 6.75
Week 4-8: 8
Week 9: 0(Submitted a blank one lol)
Week 10-12: 8
Week 13: 6

Paticipation:
Answer questions during classes or post your comments on the discussion forum. They're equivalent accoring to prof.

Finals:
60 Q of TF
7SQ
2LQ

TF: Check did you study slides
SQ: Check did you study slides, rmb to memorize the examples from the lectures
LQ:
IDK WTF did I do. Barely wrote down anything lol
just 9 blow water with no content whatsoever

fyi: I only studied for a few hours at night and in the morning before exam.
And I never read the optional readings.
But I did do revision/make notes for every week materials.

All in all, good grade i guess
reviews.comment_workload:
Fair.
There are two classes per week: one is for teaching and one is for discussion.

You can choose to watch the pre-recorded video instead of going to the lectures(That's what most people did).

But you must attend the discussion session.

There's a quiz every week but the quizzes are easy. Most of the questions can be found directly from the slides.

reviews.author: jhgrt
reviews.comment_content: The content is very interesting. It gives you a basic idea of how you can protect your business innovations by introducing copyright, trademark, patent and strategy. It's a really goooooddd CC.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is quite cute to be true and he's quite nice to explain to you the points that you might not understand. It's truly fun to attend his class. He makes his words and sentences clear to everybody in the class and he is very friendly!
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite good. Make sure you understand what you're studying and the cases that were gone through the class. It would be useful for your own learnings and also your examination grade. Attendance and participation count.
reviews.comment_workload: Ok. You'll have to watch lecture videos before doing the quiz and going to lessons every week, but it's a really good approach to get to know more about what the lesson is about before it starts. You can then ask questions that you would like to know during class. You will also be having discussions with your schoolmates.

reviews.author: anonymous:)
reviews.comment_content:
It covers four main area:
1. Copyright
2. Patent
3. Trademark, and
4. Strategy
reviews.comment_teaching:
He provides students with a lot of time to discuss and express their own opinions on certain topics.
Professor Ted's lessons are seldom boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are class participation marks, therefore, you have to be active during classes, e.g. raise and answer questions, in order to score a good grade.

Active response to the discussion board in Canvas is also recommended.
reviews.comment_workload:
A small quiz (mostly consist of 8 questions) every week. The quiz is quite easy, as you can answer most of the questions simply by referring to his lecture notes.

There are reading materials every week, but it is optional to read.

reviews.author: Kirin.K
reviews.comment_content:
四樣嘢copyright, trademark, patent, and strategy.
包含大量現實嘅例子 接近常識
reviews.comment_teaching: 採取半睇片半上堂 但係如果自己冇睇片會乜都唔識 由於堂上定用大量例子 聽落唔會好悶
reviews.comment_grading:
attendance
一般grading
reviews.comment_workload:
極少 淨係需要睇片同埋做一個quiz
基本上都唔係需要溫書就可以考final
但係唔好預自己唔使溫就會有A

reviews.author: hhhh_
reviews.title: Great Common Core Course :)
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction
Introduction to Copyright
Copyright Limitations
Derivative Work & Parody
Protecting Software Innovations
Introduction to Patents
Process of Getting a Patent & Utility Patent Requirements
Introduction to Trademark
Trademark Global Issues & Challenges
Trademark Infringing Cases
Resource-Based Strategy
Move Fast or Get Passed
reviews.comment_teaching: Great!
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grading if you work hard
Participate often during lectures, post comments on Canvas, do well on online quizzes
reviews.comment_workload: There is a decent amount of work you need to do (watch online videos before attending lectures, complete one quiz per week, post comments, read optional texts, attend lectures and make comments)

reviews.author: mokmok
reviews.comment_content:
4 key topics about intellectual property rights:
Trademark
Copyright
Patent
Strategy

- Better to understand the differences and similarity among the topics

- Memorizing all materials is not enough for the course (critical thinking and application are required)

Business student will take advantages in this course as they have experience in a business case discussion approach.
reviews.comment_teaching:
- Not boring, nice and willing to help students
- More focus on interaction with students
- Clearly explain the concept with daily examples and clarify the grey areas
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grade, good grade if you work hard and participate in the class actively.
Friendly reminder: better to keep your web camera on

Don't skip the class! Many of the discussions will provide for the key answers and ideas for the final essay

Attendance 10% (1pt per lecture, max 10 points)
Participation 20%
Quizzes 20% (13 quizzes, drop three lowest scores)
Final Exam 50% (open book timed exam)
reviews.comment_workload:
- Must watch the lecture videos and do the quiz before going to lessons every week
- Face-to-face lectures mainly for discussion about the issues and topics
- Online discussion forum (optional)
- Have a final which includes short questions and a case study

reviews.author: Harrison_kei
reviews.title: Good for you if you are interested in
reviews.comment_content:
Useful content that would be helpful for u if u are a bba students
But the content are mixed in which u need to understand the differences coz it affects ur overall understanding in general
Coverages:
-Copyright
-Parody and Derivative work
-Patient
-Trademark
reviews.comment_teaching:
The prof was nice and eager to help the students although the topics are sometimes boring.  
The group discussion were surprisingly* helpful to understand the topics well coz there are many grey areas needed to be clarified
reviews.comment_grading:
It was ok I got a B+ as a result but I hv to say u need to put effort on understanding the cases in order to help u to ans the questions in the final  
Attendance: 10% of grade
Participation: 20% of grade
Twelve Online Quizzes: 20% of grade
Final Exam: 50% of grade
reviews.comment_workload:
It is fair for those who don't want midterm exam but still hv quizzes to help u to understand the topics and prepare for the final exam.
For the attendance, u need to work with grp mates assigned and ans questions from the prof.  
Not a must for the reading materials as they doesn't count ur grade

reviews.author: Youjini
reviews.comment_content: Content is all about how the businesses sustain profits through protections. Contents are very practical and useful
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor teaches really well. He explains with lots of interesting videos and case studies
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is nice. If you attend the class every time, do not worry about catch-ups. Quizzes are all from videos so not very hard. Final is little complex as you need to write long essays while incorporating all the protection-related issues that you know
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy as you need to attend once a week and review ppts beforehand to participate in the class.

reviews.author: Joseig
reviews.comment_content:
It is something different that might come useful. It is great both for business and engineering majors. I really find it easy, just need to check the videos and think a bit the quizzes.
You sometimes have to do assignments and they seem to be easy but take a bit of time so be aware. In class you will work in teams and the participation of one member benefits the whole team.
reviews.comment_teaching: He makes it so interesting and times flies with him. He uses real life examples and they really stick, so it is easier to remember everything for the quizzes.
reviews.comment_grading: So far so good. It is not hard to get a good grade in the tests, just doble check everything.
reviews.comment_workload: It is blended learning now, so it takes a couple hours a week, but you don’t have so many class hours so it is fine. It takes me around 1-2h extra a week to keep up with everything and class in only 1.5h per week so it is not hard at all. Plus it is interesting.

reviews.author: BrianYKH
reviews.title: Good grade course if work harder
reviews.comment_content:
The content is divided into three parts. The first is copyrights, then is patents, lastly it would be trademarks.
It basically covers all means that you wish to protect your innovative products. The content lets us know how you can beat or be beaten by others by law issues. To anyone who wish to develop your own products. The course is recommended.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching, however, is a bit boring due to the mono-tone. I can observe that the professor tried to be funny, yet it's the voice issue. A great news is that the professor has got video recordings for all lectures. A bad news is that the recording quality is very low.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is very good. Get an A+ in the end, scoring 1 sd higher in quiz one, highest/ 1.5 sd higher than mean in quiz two, 0.5 to 1 sd higher in quiz three and all assignments.

Tips:
Do attend lectures, or watch videos, lots of stuff not covered in notes but repeatedly discussed in class.
Assignments are very important
Do attend mark checking sessions. Many questions kept asked again and again in quizzes that follow.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite high I would say. Three assignments. Generally you would need to write at least 4 pages to excel in each assignment.

reviews.author: chpoonag
reviews.title: Always try your best in ALL assignments and quizzes.
reviews.comment_content:
This course is mainly about patent, copyright, as well as trademark.

Although it is about law, not many things need to be recited. There are no law terms taught in class.

There are cases taught in class as examples. They can definitely help you understand the application of the law and defences. Also, they could be useful for doing assignments.

Videos of the classes are uploaded to canvas. You may skip the class if you wish. However, they may not be regularly uploaded.
reviews.comment_teaching:
You may never fall asleep in Dr Clark's lessons. One of the reasons may be that some contents may be tested and discussed in class but not shown in lecture slides. Paying attention is therefore necessary in order NOT TO FAIL the quizzes.

Another reason could be that he always explain with cases. Not only can cases help you understand, it is also interesting, like listening to stories. Sometimes, you may find so ridiculous for some arguments in some cases.

It is noted that Dr Clark might constitute an all-round intellect, having studied in the fields of engineering, information systems and economics.
reviews.comment_grading:
For details and data, please refer to the attached file.

It is noted that having a above-mean score in all assignments and quizzes is important, as it seems that just a few people can keep on his or her momentum in getting a good score in each task. So, the mean of the total score in the end may not equal to the sum of mean scores of all tasks.

In average, my score in each task is just about midway between the mean and the highest score. However, I got an A+ in the end.

In addition, as for the final individual project, you can do it whenever you want within the period from the beginning of the study period to the end of the exam period. The so-called project is not really difficult and is similar to assignments.
reviews.comment_workload:
There are extra readings with an average of 18 pages per week. The workload may be high for those who are not good at English, like me. In my view, they are not necessary as knowledge which was not taught in class had never be tested. Though suggested by the professor, extra readings may only help satisfy the needs for wider understanding.

Though there are literally no midterm and final exam, 3 quizzes, averagely 1 per month, may be strenuous for those who are not going to take revision regularly, especially for the 2nd and 3rd quizzes which includes some knowledge related to topics tests in prior quizzes.

reviews.author: edes9
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction to Copyright Laws and Issues
Protecting Software Innovations
DMCA & US Laws Impact on Global Commerce
Software Protection: Patents, Copyright, Licenses
Media and Entertainment Business Challenges
Protection of Product and Design Innovations
Engineering, Biotech and Computer Patents
Novelty and Patentability of Innovations
Utility Requirement for Innovations
Non-Obviousness and the Patenting Process
Patent Process: Issues and Challenges
Recent Patent Changes & Strategic Implications
Protecting Product Brands and Identity
Trademark Protection and Infringement
Business Issues and Implications of Trademarks
Protecting Trade Secrets & Social-economic Issues, such as Computer Crimes
International Laws and Reverse Engineering
Global Cyber-Law and Electronic Commerce
The Future for Electronic Commerce and Intellectual Property Rights

COMMENT: Fairly clear and understandable for someone with no background of this subject.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Clark is humorous in his classes. His pace is not too quick but sometimes it can be hard to catch up once you're a couple of ppt pages behind. He follows ppt most of the time but there are many examples and cases that are not in the ppt. Taking notes is a must in his class. Every class has a video recap so you can still attend his class without physically going. Quite a lot of readings but he doesn't talk about them much. Though he encourages people to read them all for exams. Sometimes he can be quite boring though.
reviews.comment_grading: I am quite average in the class but I think if you put enough effort and read through all of the ppts and memorise some of the important points you can pass easily.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. One essay only.

reviews.author: chloenhw
reviews.comment_content:
Copyright, patent, trademark, IP laws
doesnt require you to memorize the details in the IP laws but only to understand/ remember the general facts
not very difficult
more beneficial if your english is good (readings + essays)
reviews.comment_teaching:
prof is humorous
lectures are not boring at all
easy to understand
he doesnt care if you come to class or not
provides lecture videos on canvas
reviews.comment_grading:
grading is fair
no attendance
assignment and finals above mean
midterm below mean
grade: B
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignment (essay)
Midterm (T/F + essay)
Finals (T/F + short&long essay)
A LOT OF READING MATERIALS (but i didnt read all haha)

reviews.author: lcyxd
reviews.comment_content: Covers details of IP laws - from copyright, patent, trademark to trade secret. You will also get to know case  examples of how IP laws were being applied differently.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Clark is humuorous but the content itself is sometimes boring. Classes are not compulsory but it helps you to understand the concepts and theories much better as the professor would provide lots of in-depth explanation in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Written assignment 20%
Mid-term exam 30%
Final exam 50%

The mean for both written assignment and midterm is quite high. However, I would say the grading is quite good.
Below mean in assignment, above mean for mid-term while result of final exam was not released - final grading B+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Have to complete 20 readings (18 pages per reading on average) within the whole course - readings are not compulsory but they are much detailed than lecture notes and help strengthen your understanding. Final exam would also cover some case law mentioned in the readings while cumulative.

Would not recommend this course if you're not interested in law as you would probably find those readings time-consuming and boring.

reviews.author: Coco Ngor
reviews.title: Good grades with reasonable workload
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite boring but the pro is quite funny sometime. Some parts are pretty useful in a way that the majority of us have never noticed before attending this class. You can learn something factual in this course, not so much about math or logical thinking at all.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is quite funny and he provides videos on Canvas of each class for those who did not attend class. This is very good for revising during midterm and final.
reviews.comment_grading: Pretty decent. Hand in homework on time and doing fair (touching or slightly below mean) in midterm and final will already get you a B.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much at all. I got one only throughout the whole course. It was an essay like assignment requiring us to review some law cases about infringement issues.

reviews.author: Szczesny
reviews.title: Low workload to get an A range **17-18 FALL!!!**
reviews.comment_content:
Course is mainly divided into several parts:
Copyright
Patent
Trademark
Trade Secret

Things are quite boring for me as I am not really interested in law-related stuffs, but things you learned from this course are quite useful in your daily life for sure.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor has a nice character, he loves to interact with students after class. He is kind of humorous and tried to make jokes sometimes. But most of the time, he spoke in a mono tone, which made me yawn every single lesson. He has a very deep knowledge in law-related issues, and he can give many examples regarding the points on the slides.

Still, since I am not a big fan in law, most of the times I found the class boring due to his teaching style.
reviews.comment_grading:
Written assignment (20%)
Mid-term exam (30%)
Final exam (50%)

I got highest in written assignment, around -0.8 to -0.9 s.d. in mid-term, no result released in the final exam (I think I did quite well in it). Finally I get a B+, considering my disastrous performance in mid-term, grading is kind of great I suppose.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is low.

There are around 20 readings to read, with 18 pages per reading on average. They are quite difficult to understand especially for students with average English proficiency like me. Reading these materials are not required but they can help students gain extra knowledge (maybe).

I performed badly in my mid-term because I spent (more precisely, waste) too much time and effort on those readings, and oversee all those VERY SMALL details printed on the lecture notes. While stuffs in readings would not be tested in exams. After the mid-term, I read no materials and just gave them up. So, make sure you "digest" those notes well, and read them thoroughly before you go to the exams.

To achieve A range in this course, just pay attention to what professor said is more than enough. The only use of reading materials are probably as a main reference for your written assignment.

reviews.author: wahahapurewater
reviews.comment_content: Mostly covering various IP protections, including copyright, patents, trademark and trade secret. Copyright for 3-4 weeks, patents for 5-6 weeks, trademark+trade secret for 1-2 weeks. Readings are assigned per week. Cases of each IP protections are mentioned in either lecture notes or readings. Content is useful and updated, but a bit boring.
reviews.comment_teaching: I constantly sleep during CLARK's class due to his monotone teaching. He simply read according to powerpoint, but whenever he wants to explain in great detail he might spend 20+ minutes on the same slide. Time management not really good, i.e. rushing through notes when we're a bit behind and often late for class.
reviews.comment_grading: Fabulous grading. I got maximum (91/100) in my essay, 4 marks above mean in midterm and 2 marks below mean in final (without studying any readings). Still, I receive a B+.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is very light for me since I never read the readings assigned (which is why I don't know the essay questions in final). If you read every week then there's a certain workload cus each reading has 15+ pages. If you want to get a range, better study them every week, don't read them right before final.

reviews.author: theone
reviews.title: Great course - take it for the learning experience not the workload
reviews.comment_content: The content is great, you learn about intellectual property law - things like copyright, patents, trade marks, etc. All really useful stuff and must know imo. However, since you need to memorize a lot (and I mean a lot) of laws, court cases and things, it can get a bit boring/dry sometimes and difficult as well. No attendance required. Just study the material but seriously, why would you not want to attend Prof. Clark's lecture? He's one of the best!
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Clark is brilliant! He's a Harvard alumnus, a very knowledgeable individual, a great orator and also a good teacher. You can't ask for a better professor really.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is decent, nothing special here. Prof Clark is a very fair grader from my experience (I've taken 2 courses with him so I know). Not sure about the exact % of A, B and C grades though. I think it's the same as any other 2000 level course in SBM.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload during the mid-term is manageable but good God the final is cumulative and the workload is intense (a LOT of memorization is required). Consider yourself warned! Specifics are - 1 assignment (20%), midterm (30%) and final (50%). Also, there are readings that you are supposed to do before the class but it's really up to you, no one will quiz you on them in class but they become a part of the material you need to study from for the exams.

reviews.author: mksun
reviews.comment_content: It is all about copyright, patent and trademark laws in the US.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is a funny person. His explanation is very clear. However, the contents in the notes can be quite ambiguous. If you want to get a good grade, you have got to pay full attention in class and annotate whatever unclear in the notes.
reviews.comment_grading: I got an A from the course. My essay is 8X and I got the highest mark in the midterm. For the final, the mark was not released. I think you need to do great in the essay, the midterm and the final to secure an A+.
reviews.comment_workload: Besides the notes, there are quite a lot of extra reading materials. You will probably do an OK job in the midterm if you don't read the reading materials. But for the final, reading the extra materials is a must (especially the cases). I somehow missed one of cases which I thought was not quite relevant and it turned out that the professor used that case as one of the essays in the final. Then, I screwed up (I guess it was why I couldn't get an A+...).

reviews.author: Sloth
reviews.comment_content: It is all about copyright, patent and trademark. One may find it not that boring if one is interested in law.
reviews.comment_teaching: Though the professor tried to make some fun, it was still quite boring after all. He talked about ppt slides in lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
It is quite good.

Individual Assignment (20%)
Mid Term (30%): T/F+ 1 essay
Final (50%): many T/F+ few essays

The overall grading is quite good. My mid term is below mean for 0.5SD, my final is above mean for 0.2SD. And I don't know my performance in my homework. I got a B- finally.
reviews.comment_workload:
I think the only workload is the individual assignment.
There are some weekly required readings. But I will say these readings are not that "required" if you are aiming a B/B-. Lessons are not that "required" as well.

reviews.author: KSD
reviews.comment_content: This course deals with laws - mostly copyrights and patents. This would be helpful for business students who want to get basic knowledge about copyright or patent.
reviews.comment_teaching: The lecture is a bit boring. Not many students come to the class to listen. The professor uploads ppt and required readings to the canvas.
reviews.comment_grading: Grades may be not satisfactory although you get good grades on written assignment.
reviews.comment_workload: There is one assignment, one midterm and final exam. So there is no tension for finishing required readings on time. However there are a lot of reading materials

reviews.author: unspecified
reviews.title: Pretty good course
reviews.comment_content: Not too difficult, teaches copyright, patent, trademark and trade secret (making up the protections for business innovations. Can be learnt without much effort.
reviews.comment_teaching: Can be very repetitive but overall good lecture notes and teaches well. His voice can be quite dull at times, however, and sometimes it makes it very difficult to pay attention in class.
reviews.comment_grading: Easy grading, easy to get high marks. Got above mean for both assignment and midterm, but mean is quite high for everything (~80+)
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload.
One midterm (multiple choice, true-or-false and one essay questions), one assignment, and final (multiple choice + essays).
However, he recommends doing readings, and if you do them the workload is quite high.

reviews.author: qctarget
reviews.title: Quite Boring
reviews.comment_content: This course introduced Intellectual Property Laws in US. The contents were easy to understand, but, my classmates and I always found grey area of the laws, and this was what Clark always said.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor was extremely well educated with several degrees in different disciplines. He was good at telling story, the bed-time one. I appreciated how he prepared many jokes for the class. However, his voice was too deep and dull to me (in fact not only me, but also more than half of the class), I felt hard to concentrate in class.

But if you are interested in the course topic itself, then I do not think you will face the problem I encountered.
reviews.comment_grading:
Though I got a B for this course, I think the grading of this course is in fact quite fair. Hence I give an A for its grading.
I scored slightly below mean for the individual assignments and midterm. I did not know how I perform for the final exam as he did not publish the marks to students. Given that my below mean scores and I got a B for this course, I think the grading was fair. I'm sure he is not a so-called "killer".
reviews.comment_workload:
Absolutely light workload. (if the readings were not counted)
What I had to do throughout the semester was only one individual essay, that was all. Other than the essay, I did not have anything related to this course except the deadline fighting revision and reading before exams.

But, if you do the readings regularly on a weekly basis, you may find easier to follow him in lecture. That may increases your workload. But as I did not do that, I would not take those readings as part of my workload.

reviews.author: abcde
reviews.comment_content:
教d野好易明
例如 版權 商標 專利
明concepts就得 唔使背野
主要都集中講美國既法例
因為professor係美國人
reviews.comment_teaching:
上堂好輕鬆
會播下片
教concepts 非常易明 會用好多例子
等你易d明
reviews.comment_grading:
有認得聽書加埋溫熟powerpoints既話
真係好易拎B range
reviews.comment_workload:
只係得1份 case study
之後得midterm final
workload 極低

reviews.author: TheTurtle
reviews.comment_content: Patents, Copyright, Trademark. That's all it's about. Not very useful knowledge in daily life or non-law related careers but at least professor tries to spice things up by including a ton of real life examples.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very nice and friendly professor. Likes to tell stories and does it well too. The shame is the nature of the content is too dull to begin with but considering that he still does a good job.
reviews.comment_grading:
Individual Assignment 20%
Mid-Term Examination 30% (In class)
(closed book, closed notes, multiple choice and one essay)
Final Examination 50% (closed book, closed notes, multiple choice and essays)
reviews.comment_workload: Very very low workload. Only one essay assignment and just a few pages long. Quite a few course materials to read but not really necessary to read all because many concepts are repeated multiple times.

reviews.author: Francis So
reviews.title: A course with extremely good grade
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite useful and interesting, especially for those in business school. Even if you are from other schools, the content is easy to understand for sure.
reviews.comment_teaching: a lot of group discussion / videos / reading materials
reviews.comment_grading:
super good as long as you finish all the online quizzes and be proactive in classes
And remember not to skip classes as attendance is needed.
reviews.comment_workload:
Canvas quiz each week and you have to go through all the lecture videos before doing those quizzes. Usually, you can get them all correct.

Answer more questions, try to demonstrate your passion and proactiveness to the professor and TAs so that you can easily get high marks. For the final exam, it was quite challenging to me so you have to study harder and make sure that you memorize all the details that are included in lecture videos/lectures.

reviews.author: davidsaur
reviews.title: Vague content and non-transparent grading
reviews.comment_content:
Pretty low nutrition content in my opinion... just spending an hour or two reading the relevant pages on Justia or Wikipedia is equivalent to a semester's worth of content.

The content mostly covers:
Copyright
Patent
Trademark
a little bit of DMCA, cyberlaw, electronic commerce

However, nearly none (~20%?) of the content taught on the slides or from the readings will appear on the quizzes/exams while the rest (~80%?) is pretty much a game of law trivia imo.
So, you should spend the time to read relevant materials online as much as you can to get good grades.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor has a decent accent and is pretty knowledgeable about the course's content - seems like he even opened a pretty much exact course on Coursera. He tries to interact with students although the monotone makes most of us fall asleep hahah.

Other than ending classes up to half an hour early occasionally, barely replying to any emails (only 1 or 2 on his liking), and designing exam questions like trivia, Ted is a pretty friendly lad.
reviews.comment_grading:
2 Assignments 30% (15% each)
3 Quizzes (mainly MCQ) 45% (15% each)
1 Final assignment 25%

Getting above mean by a fair amount for everything will only get you a B+ so aim high.

Grades for each quiz/assignment were released weeks after the deadline.
Quiz 3 and the Final assignment grades were never released.
The grading criteria for the assignments were not released either - seems pretty much graded depending on whether your ideas match with the grader's.

Overall, grading lacks transparency.
reviews.comment_workload:
Pretty low workload.
Around 18 pages of readings per week and no attendance (the lectures are available online as well).
3 assignments (including final), each of which can all be completed within a day.

reviews.author: Devi
reviews.title: Business Protection for Innovation
reviews.comment_content: More about patent, trademarks and copyright. The topic includes cases, issues, e-commerce laws, software protection and many more. The topic may also include design protection, biotech and engineering innovation protection, semiconductor chip protection act, DMCA laws and some computer patents.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very funny and his class is highly recommended. His examples in lectures may also be out for exam. There is no attendance but coming to lecture may help you understand more about the topic.   He gave a lot of cases as an example to help you understand and his examples may be out for exam.
reviews.comment_grading: Very lenient grading. Got 74/100 in assignment and 79/100 in midterm. The score for final exam is not released. The mean is quite high, 66 for assignment and 77 for midterm.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite high. There are a lot of reading materials every week. There are about 20 pages every week. The readings are useful to understand more about the content and some question in exam may be be based on the readings. The assignment is quite difficult and need some research.

reviews.author: xdxdxd
reviews.comment_content: Mostly related to copyright, patent, trademark and software protection. It is not difficult as the content just cover some basic concepts of IP rights protection. You can gain a very comprehensive knowledge of IP rights after the course.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is knowledgeable and nice. However, the lecture is quite boring as I always sleep in the class. No attendance is needed and the professor will upload the video on canvas. So if you sleep in the class or skip the class, you can always review it in canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
fabulous grading
Assignment---------20%
Mid-term-------------30%
Final-------------------50%
I got  80 marks in assignment, (highest.86), and i got 92 in mid-term (highest.97). Although the professor did not give out the result of final, I know my final was f**ked up as I left one big essay question blank. However ,it turned out that I got an A.

The mid-term is around 70% MC with a small essay question. To me, the final was much difficult as there are around 100 MC, 5 short questiuon, and 2 big essay question.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light if the reading is not counted. However,if you want to get good grade, you must read the reading (but not all). Lecture will cover almost all of the MC appeared on the mid-term and final. Some readings are not important as they just help you to understand or provide supplementary information. But the readings with lawsuit cases are very important. xd

reviews.author: ValerieKo
reviews.comment_content: About the details  of the IP laws, namely copyright, patent, trademark and trade secret. Contains a lot of examples to explain the different applications of them.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Clark is so funny, every lesson is more than enjoyable. He makes it so easy to learn during the lesson. Plus lecture videos are provided so it eases our job in understanding the difficult concept.
reviews.comment_grading: Very good grade, for me, I strewed up the essay but that doesn't really reflect on the final grade.
reviews.comment_workload: An essay, a mid-term and a final with no homework so it's pretty manageable.

reviews.author: LouisLaw
reviews.comment_content:
Copyright Laws, Patent Laws, DMCA, Trademark, Trade Secret, and E-Commerce

A lots of examples and applications of these laws in actual life scenario, and apart from laws, Clark also taught some basic business tactics in lectures.

Suitable for those want to engage in innovation and want to know how to protect their innovation, or how to use laws to steal others' innovation.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I slept again and again in his lecture, and before midterm exam I already no longer go to his lecture because of his monotone and boring slides, do all the reading material is enough for exams or learning the whole content.
Also there should be lecture videos provided.
reviews.comment_grading: I got 60/100 in the assignment, I skipped the mid-term, I did not revise much on final, and turn out I have C+. So, the grading is quite good I guess.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not heavy.

You have an assignment to finish before mid-term exam, that assignment is easy and simple to do as long as you willing to spend a few days to do research on internet, or two days is enough if you are smart. It is about copyright issue and DMCA.

and there is a in-class close book midterm exam, which can be skipped if you want, by doing so only assignment and final exam will be count in grading.

You also have some reading to do, but those are very short reading and if you really want to learn more, those readings provide a lot more information than the lectures do.

Clark may told you those readings are important to exam, and I can tell you his words are all bs. If you only want to fulfill core requirement, you can skip those readings.

reviews.author: joostinl
reviews.comment_content: The course covers a wide range of Issues concerning IP rights, very often if not always aided with several case examples which the professor will discuss with and explain to the class. IP rights covered include copyright, patent, trademark, trade secrets + a few smaller topics like chip mask. It is quite informative and a great experience for those who are interested in topics this field.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Clark is very knowledgeable in this field and always welcomes questions from students and would even devote class time to discuss questions raised if he finds it interesting enough. His delivery is very good and clear, and is very friendly and approachable. You would not normally see the TA other than at exams and paper checking though.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 20%
Midterm 30%
Final 50%

No attendance not required but going to lessons help a lot in terms of your understanding of the materials.

One written assignment (likely on copyright)
Midterm: around 40 T/F questions, 1 essay type question.
Final: around 80-100 T/F questions, several short written questions and 1/2 long essay type questions.
All of which would have elements of classroom discussions / reading materials weaved into them.
T/F questions are often tricky and there might be some classroom-exclusive materials being included in assessment.
reviews.comment_workload: The mandatory workload of the course is not big at all, as you only have to hand in one written assignment early in the course and go to the midterm and final and that is it. But if you want to understand the topics thoroughly, then you have to go through the readings too, which on average you have to read 18 pages per week. The readings are not the easiest to understand but helps a lot in both assignment and exams.

reviews.author: Beatrice
reviews.comment_content: The content is excellent.  We learnt about patent, copyright, trademark, trade secrets etc. which were all very useful and gave us a comprehensive introduction to business protections for innovations .  However, as all materials were taught in 2-3 months, it was a little crammed.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Clark's teaching is excellent.  The class is riveting and full of intellectual interactions.  He makes difficult concepts very easy to understand.  You would not want to miss his class even though he won't take attendance.  If you do not understand the class or would like to ask him more about issues related to what is taught in class, he is more than willing to help you out.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment - 20%
Closed-book Mid-term exam - 30%
Closed-book Final exam- 50%
The grading is really good.  As long as you are above mean for everything, you will at least get a B+.
The mid-term exam had around 60 True or False questions and one essay question which could be prepared before hand.
The final exam was more challenging.  There were around 100 T/F questions, 5 short questions and 2 essays.
reviews.comment_workload: Throughout the entire course, we only had to submit 1 essay.  The essay was quite thought-provoking and challenging, but Professor Clark would discuss the essay in class.  We had to read around 20 pages of reading materials which helps you understand the teaching every week.  If you let the reading materials pile up till one week or two before mid-term/final exam, it would be very difficult, if not impossible, to finish all the reading materials.  Professor Clark does not like rote memorization.   Understanding the cases and remembering the important ones should suffice.

reviews.author: sun and moon
reviews.comment_content: it was easy and the professor was perfect. Had interesting time listening to the class. Sometimes I had hard time understanding, but it was good to follow since I had a lot of time to ask professor questions regarding the things that I was not able to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: good and easy to understand. sometimes It might  be hard but if you just follow well it won't be hard.
reviews.comment_grading: not bad . just strive hard and do your best, then surely you will make it.
reviews.comment_workload: just right not too many and not too small work to do.

reviews.author: MaGGIe513
reviews.title: Worst TA ever met CHAN, Hiu Ying
reviews.comment_content: Business Protection starting from copyright law patent, teademark etc. Not too difficult and easy to understand
reviews.comment_teaching:
There will be a lecture video every week, student have to watch the video before class and finish the quiz. One lecture per week, mainly explaining the quiz questions. Also group discussion in class around 10-20 minutes every lecture.
The TA CHAN, Hiu Ying will be sitting near the door doing nothing.
reviews.comment_grading: worst grading I have ever got, thanks to TA CHAN, Hiu Ying
reviews.comment_workload:
Only one quiz per week, it takes around 10 mins to finish, low workload
However, in week 8, there will be a assignment. There are 3 Q&A questions in total. The answer is obvious but be careful of the TA, CHAN, Hiu Ying. She just deduct half of my marks and say I was copying. At first she said I copy from a China web(did not specify),  and later she said I copy from another student. It just make no sense, student are not allowed to check the similarity form the turnitin system ( the TA had blocked this function), at last this irresponsible TA ask me to submit another work but will count me as late submission, and will deduct half of my marks.
Because of this rediculous TA CHAN, Hiu Ying, I got the minimum marks in class.

reviews.author: SB
reviews.title: Nice course to learn about IP protection
reviews.comment_content:
This course covers 4 main topics
1. Copyright
2. Patents
3. Trademark
4. Business Strategy
This is a common core course from SBM, you can learn different ways to protect your innovation which I think is quite interesting
reviews.comment_teaching: This is a course in a blended learning mode. You have to watch lecture videos on canvas and then attend class. Professor would discuss about the quiz and have some case studies during the live section.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance - 10%
Quiz - 20%
Participation in class - 20%
Final exam (in online mode this semester) - 50%
reviews.comment_workload: Since it's blended learning, every week you normally watch lecture videos for 1.5 hours, then you have to complete a MC quiz with 8 questions. If you have any questions, you may join the discussion on canvas.

reviews.author: zaolo45
reviews.title: First Impressions
reviews.comment_content: The content seems relevant in various types of IP law. Patents, copyright, and trademarks are laid out in an easy format for studying throughout the class.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is interactive, but very powerpoint based. You can get by in the class by only watching the class recordings, as those are posted for each course.
reviews.comment_grading: No final exam! However, three cumulative "quizzes" that are basically exams. Also, there is a final writing assignment that is due at the end of the term.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload seems rather low. He says that the course readings average around 18 pages, but only half of the class actually does it. No attendance!
